summary: This memorandum details a meeting with Dr. Miro in New York City on October 16, 1961, where they discussed the situation in Cuba, including the suffering of Cubans under Castro, the need for his overthrow, and the role of the Consejo (CRC) in fomenting opposition. Miro expressed concerns about the lack of a central plan, the infiltration of people into Cuba without Council involvement, and the need for arms and money for clandestine groups. He also discussed propaganda efforts and the involvement of various individuals and organizations in the Cuban resistance movement.
title: Meeting with Dr. Miro in New York City on October 16, 1961
